waist_guide: Measure your waist at the narrowest point, typically above your navel and below your rib cage.
hip_guide: Measure your hips at the widest point around your buttocks. Keep the measuring tape horizontal and snug, but not compressing the area.
normal_desc: A healthy waist-to-hip ratio indicates a lower risk of heart disease and diabetes.
risk_desc: A moderate risk indicates an increased likelihood of health issues. Lifestyle changes are recommended.
high_risk_desc: A high risk indicates a significantly increased risk of heart disease, stroke, and diabetes. Medical consultation is recommended.
